sentences.en: A large capital ship armed with broadside firing cannons.
sentences.cn: 卡拉克战舰侧舷密集排列舷炮,适合远洋航行.

sentences.en: A man was driving to work when a truck ran a stop sign ... hit his car broadside, and knocked him cold.
sentences.cn: 有个人开车行驶在上班的路上，一辆卡车闯红灯从侧面撞上了他的车，当时他就不省人事了。

sentences.en: Broadside winds crabbed the boat close to riverbank.
sentences.cn: 从舷侧吹过来的风使船斜行到河岸.
他的车从侧面撞了我的车.

sentences.en: Of course gate was only four feet wide or so , he couldn't bring rail in broadside.
sentences.cn: 当然,院门大约只有四英尺宽, 木板横着是过不去的.

sentences.en: The boat is drifting broadside on.
The boats are broadside on the shore and each row is made fast, side by side, the whole secured by chains and anchored at the outer side to keep them in position.
sentences.cn: 船横靠在岸边，每条船都并排紧紧地绑在一起，链条穿起每条船保证安全，在外侧把锚放下固定它们的位置。

sentences.en: The car hit the truck broadside on.
sentences.cn: 小汽车撞了卡车的侧面.

sentences.en: The reviewer leveled a broadside at the novel.
sentences.cn: 书评家对那本小说作了猛烈抨击.

sentences.en: The ship came broadside to the dock.
sentences.cn: 船一边面向着码头驶来.

sentences.en: the ship swung broadside on to the current of the river.
sentences.cn: 船转了方向，迎水流侧向前行。

sentences.en: The ship was broadside to the dock.
The ship was moored broadside to the pier.
The train hit the truck broadside.
sentences.cn: 火车从侧面撞上了卡车.

sentences.en: The train rammed the car broadside.
The truck hit the car broadside on.
The wave caught the canoe broadside and capsized it.
sentences.cn: 波浪冲向了独木舟的舷侧,把独木舟掀翻了.

sentences.en: Yes. These two cars collided broadside.
sentences.cn: 对.这两辆车是从侧面相撞的.

trans.tran_cn: 侧对着，侧向地，漫无目标地，胡乱地
<船>（吃水线以上的）舷侧，（书面或口头的）猛烈抨击，全部舷侧炮，宽阔面
trans.tran_en: an attack in which all the guns on one side of a ship are fired at the same time
